Reference¶

Data models¶

class django_mail_template.models.MailAttachment(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶
file¶

File to be attached to mail.

class django_mail_template.models.MailTemplate(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Mail():

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶
attachments¶

Field with the files attached to the mail.

clean()[source]¶

Hook for doing any extra model-wide validation after clean() has been called on every field by self.clean_fields. Any ValidationError raised by this method will not be associated with a particular field; it will have a special-case association with the field defined by NON_FIELD_ERRORS.

code¶

Field holding the code to identify the mail configuration

destiny¶

Field with destiny email address.

sender¶

Field with sender (from) email address.

subject¶

Subject for the mail. Context variable can be used

Tests¶

class tests.test_models.TestAttachment(methodName='runTest')[source]¶
setUp() → None[source]¶

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

class tests.test_models.TestConfiguration(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Store dynamic configuration data used to set up django_mail working.

Builtin key process:

  • ‘LOG_MAIL_ACTIVITY’: A configuration with this value in process attribute will configure django_mail to log mail activity.

class tests.test_models.TestLogMailTemplate(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

Store mail activity.
